title: internal compiler error: cannot relate bound region: ReEarlyBound(7289, TypeSpace, 0, 'a) <= ReStatic

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Hit this bug converting my code from using moving to references, ie: started adding lifetime specifiers. I don't exactly know what is happening to give more context sorry.
## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
rustc 1.1.0
binary: rustc
commit-hash: unknown
commit-date: unknown
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.1.0

Backtrace:
08:12:05 ~/Source/tox/src/lisp 146 $ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo build
   Compiling tox v0.0.2 (file:///Users/rudolph/Source/tox)
/Users/rudolph/Source/tox/src/lib.rs:1:1: 1:1 error: internal compiler error: cannot relate bound region: ReEarlyBound(7289, TypeSpace, 0, 'a) <= ReStatic
/Users/rudolph/Source/tox/src/lib.rs:1 #![cfg_attr(feature="dynlink-eval", feature(std_misc))]
                                       ^
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
